title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 09 November 2012 - XWiki
content: has quit 00:04  has joined #xwiki 00:07  has quit 00:19  has joined #xwiki 00:22  has quit 00:24  has joined #xwiki 00:33  has quit 00:59  has joined #xwiki 01:06  Is it ok to omit bin/view in a production site? 01:06  I want to omit bin from the URL. 01:06  has joined #xwiki 01:07  I'm going to do it with apache httpd and tomcat. 01:08  has quit 01:08  is now known as 01:09  has quit 01:09  has quit 01:11  has quit 01:14  hello? 01:15  cjd : Are you there? 01:22  has quit 01:34  has joined #xwiki 01:44  has quit 01:47  has quit 01:59  has joined #xwiki 02:00  has left #xwiki 02:00  It is so intuitive to install XWiki provided that one knows tomcat deployment a little. 02:02  Hey, does anyone know why I get this message trying to add a new user: "Passwords are different or password is empty"? 02:03  hey yo 02:03  hey 02:10  has joined #xwiki 02:20  has quit 02:41  has quit 02:45  has joined #xwiki 02:55  has quit 02:57  How do I launch the startup wizard? 02:57  I dropped xwiki database and recreated it, but the wizard doesn't appear. 03:20  has joined #xwiki 03:25  After importing xwiki-enterprise-ui-all-4.3-milestone-1.xar into an empty xwiki, the application panel doeesn't list any application. The screenshot is http://imagebin.org/235202 03:29  The version of tomcat is 6.0.35, and that of java is 1.6.x 03:31  has quit 03:36  ok 03:36  It now displays applications in the application panel. 03:36  I think it was due to OutOfMemory exceptions. 03:36  hmm... 03:37  How foolish. 03:56  has joined #xwiki 04:07  has quit 04:30  has joined #xwiki 04:31  has joined #xwiki 04:42  has quit 04:48  Why do I keep seeing an error like Exception in thread "Core extension repository updater" java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space ? 04:48  Java heap space? 04:55  Is xwiki unstable on tomcat6? 04:59  jesus 04:59  christ 04:59  debian tomcat's init.d script is buggy 05:00  It doesn't really pass JAVA\_OPTS to java. 05:00  That's why I saw lots of OutOfMemory exceptions. 05:07  has joined #xwiki 05:17  has quit 05:28  has quit 05:34  has joined #xwiki 05:43  has joined #xwiki 05:53  has quit 05:59  has quit 06:01  has joined #xwiki 06:03  has quit 06:08  Why does xwiki lack icons in applications panel? 06:08  I just imported the UI. 06:19  has joined #xwiki 06:29  has quit 06:49  Distribution Wizard times out during installation of UI. 06:49  How can I prevent that from happening? 06:54  has joined #xwiki 06:57  has joined #xwiki 06:59  vmassol, If I install UI extensions via XAR, applications panel doesn't have any icon. 06:59  vmassol, I had to use distribution wizard to install them correctly. 07:05  vmassol, Do you have any clue? 07:05  has quit 07:24  has quit 07:29  has joined #xwiki 07:30  has joined #xwiki 07:42  has quit 07:43  indent module icons are grayed out!! 07:43  What is wrong? 07:53  has joined #xwiki 07:56  has quit 07:59  no one? 08:01  bold, italic, underline, strikethrough, and teletype are not shown in WYSIWYG toolbaqr. 08:01  help 08:03  has quit 08:08  has joined #xwiki 08:11  ok 08:11  I didn't have the modules loaded. 08:17  has quit 08:17  Do any of you know why indent is disabled most of the time in WYSIWYG editor? 08:20  has joined #xwiki 08:25  has joined #xwiki 08:27  has joined #xwiki 08:28  The title of Main.WebHome is $msg.get("xe.home.title") 08:28  Where do I get and set the value of xe.home.title? 08:29  has quit 08:29  has quit 08:32  has joined #xwiki 08:37  has joined #xwiki 08:41  How can I restrict anonymous users from creating spaces? 08:43  How can I allow anonymous users to edit pages but not create spaces? 08:44  everybody sleeping? 08:44  How can we stop you from asking questions? Seriously you're asking too many question. Open source works with a give-give. We've already answered a lot of your questions. You now need to contribute something to the project and then when people see you contributing they'll be more inclined to help you in return 08:45  http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Contributing 08:46  vmassol, finally, an answer. 08:49  vmassol, Sorry for asking many questions. Sometimes even I can't stop myself. 08:50  I shall work on my character. 08:51  you basically have 2 options: 08:51  - pay someone to help you (this is professional services) 08:51  - give-give, you do something for the project, people help you in return 08:52  ATM we've already answered a lot of your questions so you now need to help substantially on something :) 08:52  BTW none of us is paid to answer questions, we do it out of our own good will 08:53  (and it means taking time for the work we're doing, which is the one that is paid ;)) 08:57  has joined #xwiki 08:57  I'm not sure how promising XWiki project is, but if it's sure to be sustained well for lots of years, there will be a chance for me to write some modules. 09:05  has quit 09:10  crocket: When I set out to find a good wiki, xwiki seemed like the best alternative on tha market. 09:11  Inge-, When? 09:11  My concern is that they are trying to do too much tho 09:11  a few months ago 09:11  I reviewed a lot of them 09:14  has joined #xwiki 09:15  has joined #xwiki 09:16  Inge-, a lot 09:16  XWiki seems the best to me, too. 09:16  has quit 09:16  The concern is that not many people seem to hang around here. 09:17  has joined #xwiki 09:19  has joined #xwiki 09:19  Inge-: what part is "too much" in your opinion? 09:20  has joined #xwiki 09:20  (note that most of us agree and we're trying to focus on improving what exists already) 09:20  the big new stuff is the EM 09:20  that could be considered too much 09:21  but we need it to allow more collaboration 09:21  from the community 09:21  EM? 09:21  extension manager 09:22  Stupid debian 09:23  I wasted lots of hours due to debian peculiarities. 09:24  has quit 09:28  has joined #xwiki 09:28  crocket: the people you will find "hanging" here are the developers :) 09:36  has quit 09:37  has joined #xwiki 09:52  Inge-: would implementing this skin http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Improvements/Skin4x be in the "too much" category you think? 09:52  oops myxwiki.org seems down just now 09:53  it's back 09:53  let's see 09:54  Having the flexibility to redesign skins is one of the things I like about it. 09:54  bb in 10mn 09:55  Ideally, a wiki should be very \*very\* easy for people to start using, while providing support for making good looking, well-performing pages. It should include decent search capabilites, good support for backup, clean upgrade paths and support exporting data to other formats so you don't fear being "locked in" 09:55  I thought the Word addin was a very neat idea - 09:56  Letting people write in Word and publish on the wiki 09:56  But I'm not sure how well that one works, since you get a lot of "noise" in your wiki page source when doing that (not to mention that I had to hack my hosts file to get the addin installed, since the files are not correctly placed any longer...) 09:58  And with todays world, having a mobile/tablet friendly skin is definitely not "too much" 09:59  Xwiki delivers on almost everything I was looking for 10:21  Inge-: indeed mobile is probably going to be one of domain we're going to work on in 5.x (we still haven't the brainstorming about 5.x but that's my guess) 10:21  I also liked the word addin but the main developer has left the project 10:21  so we're in need of a contributor to continue it 10:22  I've thought about it :P 10:22  :) 10:22  would be neat 10:23  has joined #xwiki 10:24  has joined #xwiki 10:24  has joined #xwiki 10:28  Enygma`: I haven't checked other classes but I saw a missing @since in SolrQueryExecutor (I have added it) 10:29  ok I've now checked and all classes are missing @since in solr-api 10:35  vmassol: yes, I realized that yesterday as well :) Looking at the code style tips, it is not clear if the @since tag should be used only in interfaces or everywhere. 10:36  well interfaces are really mandatory 10:36  and for me everywhere is best, makes it easy to see when a class was introduced 10:36  actually 10:36  what's mandatory is all public APIs 10:36  interfaces or classes 10:37  but there is no public API now :P 10:37  just internal API :) 10:37  now for me it's best to have it everywhere since it makes it easy to know 10:37  when something was inroduced 10:37  otherwise it's hard 10:37  but I agree 10:37  you have to look at reelase dates 10:37  and history 10:41  vmassol: also, should we limit the use of @since to classes or should we do it for each method individually as well? 10:42  classes=classes/interfaces 10:43  has joined #xwiki 10:44  actually, I assume you start with @since on the class/interface and, as you add new methods in future versions, you tag only those new methods with the corresponding @since tag for the version they were introduced, while the initial methods are not tagged (meaning that they were introduced with the initial class/interface) 10:54  Hello. I am looking at https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-tools/xwiki-platform-tool-rootwebapp/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/XWikiRootServlet.java and I see a comment there 10:55  The address to redirect to (the name of the XWiki webapp). Configured using the redirectTo 10:55  \* initialization parameter in web.xml. 10:55  but I don't see any redirectTo param in web.xml. Am i missing something ? 11:01  sburjan: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-tools/xwiki-platform-tool-rootwebapp/src/main/webapp/WEB-INF/web.xml#L30 11:03  Enygma`: thanks. I was searching it in web.xml from the jetty+hsql package, not in sources 11:08  Enygma`: the first you create a class/interface you put the since at the class level 11:08  then when methods are introduced later on in different versions, you put a @since at the method level 11:08  Enygma`: ah just seen your next message ;) 11:08  so yes :) 11:10  cool :) 11:15  Enygma`: the webstandards test for Main.SolrSearch is still failing 11:16  has joined #xwiki 11:17  has joined #xwiki 11:19  mflorea: it's been driving me nuts :) 11:24  hi. i am trying to import our dokuwiki to xwiki using ImportDokuWiki. it spews some "messages admin.importer.unselectAll, admin.importer.selectAll 11:24  $dokuWikiImporter.setScriptPath($scriptPath)$dokuWikiImporter.setScriptPath($rootFolder)$dokuWikiImporter.setScriptPath($defaultRootSpaceName) admin.importer.noFilesAvailable" and doesn't iport any files. The structure in the zip is "/dokuwiki/data/pages/" .and there lots of pages and attachments in there. am i missing something in the configuration of the extension? 11:52  guys, what do we do with all these opened issues? http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&jqlQuery=Project+in+%28%22XWiki+Commons%22%2C+%22XWiki+Rendering%22%2C+%22XWiki+Platform%22%2C+%22XWiki+Enterprise%22%2C+%22XWiki+Enterprise+Manager%22%29+and+fixVersion+in+%28%224.3-milestone-2%22%29+and+resolution+in+%28%22Unresolved%22%29 11:53  please close the ones that are done so we can decide what we need to move to the next versions 11:54  fmancinelli: please add documentation for the lucene REST issue http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/IssueNavigator!executeAdvanced.jspa?jqlQuery=Project+in+%28%22XWiki+Commons%22%2C+%22XWiki+Rendering%22%2C+%22XWiki+Platform%22%2C+%22XWiki+Enterprise%22%2C+%22XWiki+Enterprise+Manager%22%29+and+fixVersion+in+%28%224.3-milestone-2%22%29+and+resolution+in+%28%22Fixed%22%29+and+%28%28Documentation+is+EMPTY%29+or+%28%22Documentation+in+Release+Notes%22+is+EMPTY%29%29&ru 11:59  mflorea: is this issue still valid http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8203 ? 12:00  if yes, then I will probably move it to 4.4m1 12:02  yes 12:02  same question for http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8252 12:02  if there are no commits you should move it to the next version 12:03  both issues are valid 12:03  ok, moved both to 4.4m1 12:07  moving blockers to 4.3RC1 12:12  has quit 12:12  thanks 12:14  Enygma`, done. Just put N/A because everything is in the Issue description 12:15  thanks 12:19  Most of the tests should be fixed now (at least they pass locally). Waiting for CI to finish the build/tests to see the status. 12:45  has joined #xwiki 12:59  has quit 13:04  mflorea: cool. I see you`ve addressed the escaping test issues. How about test-ui? 13:08  has joined #xwiki 13:19  Enygma`: ui tests were affected by the same issue 13:19  has quit 13:19  ok 13:21  has joined #xwiki 13:35  has quit 13:40  vmassol: the clirr exclude in https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/blame/master/pom.xml seems to be applied while the pom was using 4.2-SNAPSHOT (4.2M3 according to http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise42M3). Looks to me like a clirr exclude that should have been removed with the release of 4.2 final. 13:41  also, note that it is not featured in the 4.2 Final release notes: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki42#HAPIBreakages 13:41  has quit 13:42  Enygma`: if it builds without the exclude then yes we need to remove it 13:42  the RM must have forgotten 13:42  testing 13:45  has joined #xwiki 13:54  has quit 13:54  yes, can be removed. 13:55  cool 14:08  has joined #xwiki 14:10  has quit 14:14  has quit 14:33  mflorea: can you also please add documentation for the remaining issues http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/IssueNavigator!executeAdvanced.jspa?jqlQuery=Project+in+%28%22XWiki+Commons%22%2C+%22XWiki+Rendering%22%2C+%22XWiki+Platform%22%2C+%22XWiki+Enterprise%22%2C+%22XWiki+Enterprise+Manager%22%29+and+fixVersion+in+%28%224.3-milestone-2%22%29+and+resolution+in+%28%22Fixed%22%29+and+%28%28Documentation+is+EMPTY%29+or+%28%22Documentation+in+Release+Notes%22+is+EMPTY% 14:34  ok, I see the release notes are locked by you so I imagine you`re already on it. 14:34  :) 15:49  "The requested URL /xwiki/resources/js/xwiki/wysiwyg/xwe/WikiService.gwtrpc was not found on this server" 15:49  hmm 16:36  we are only left with test-ui that is in a bad shape 16:55  fixing ui tests must be easy 16:55  there's an invalid character 16:57  it's this char: http://www.fileformat.info/info/unicode/char/2019/index.htm 17:11  vmassol: yes, I can see that from the tests :) but where is it? 17:11  that's easy tofind out 17:11  guys, I fixed the tests 17:11  mflorea: the ui tests? 17:11  yes 17:11  just now? 17:11  no, this afternoon 17:11  so it hasn't run yet? 17:12  01:19:02 PM) mflorea: Most of the tests should be fixed now (at least they pass locally). Waiting for CI to finish the build/tests to see the status. 17:12  (02:19:10 PM) mflorea: Enygma`: ui tests were affected by the same issue 17:12  yes but that was 5 hours ago 17:12  how come jenkins is still failing? 17:12  we need to fix the CI 17:12  i.e. it was down 17:13  ah? 17:13  I see it up 17:13  now 17:13  but it was down 1h ago or so 17:13  hmmm 17:13  any idea why it was down? 17:13  you restarted it? 17:14  no 17:14  and no, I don't know why it was down 17:15  maybe it was just really slow 17:15  still, it's not in a good shape 17:15  occasionally it took really long to load a page 17:15  yes 17:15  same here 17:17  vmassol: are you sure that`s the character that is causing problems? 17:17  no 17:19  Enygma`: I was about to run the ui tests in debug mode 17:19  guys 17:19  :) 17:19  when marius said it's fixed 17:19  however I was looking at the code 17:19  it was an encoding issue in oldcore, in property displayers 17:20  ' (apostrophe) was replaced with a wrong char in attribute value 17:20  and in VelocityMacro.java 17:20  has quit 17:20  when there's an excpetion 17:20  we display the original content 17:20  that's fixed also 17:20  but in the macro we run some clean filter 17:21  so what's displayed in the exception is probably not the real things that velocity is choking on 17:21  what's fixed mflorea? 17:22  some tests were failing because of the NPE in XWikiDocument#getMetaDataDiff 17:22  I thought you were referring to this 17:22  yes seen your commit but I'm talking about VelcoityMacro here 17:22  which gives misleading information IMO 17:22  no 17:22  well 17:23  vmassol: if I run grep "$(printf '\u2019')" . -R I only get translation files or translated document content 17:23  and can make it hard to understand the problem 17:23  the wrong char is in the value of a object property, which is evaluated as Velocity so it fails 17:23  mainly for the languages zh\_TW, ca, fr 17:23  so 17:23  to make it clear 17:23  mflorea: ok so it woudln't help 17:24  so when velocity says: line 1, it's part of some sub evaluation of the original content 17:24  yes 17:24  but you don't know which object property 17:25  (if it's an object prop) 17:25  yes, it's a pity we don't get more details from velocity rendering 17:25  s/rendering/evaluation 17:27  I`ve just run the RegisterWithoutLiveValidationTest locally and they pass 17:28  ci will also finish soon test-ui to validate it 17:41  has quit 17:42  it's failing :( 17:42  http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/1768/console 17:42  5 failures... 17:43  Tests run: 179, Failures: 0, Errors: 5, Skipped: 1 17:43  http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/1768/ 17:43  a pity marius logged off 17:43  :) 17:43  he must have sensed it 17:43  ;) 17:43  all tests are fialing for the same reason 17:44  org.openqa.selenium.interactions.MoveTargetOutOfBoundsException: Element cannot be scrolled into view:[object HTMLLIElement] 17:44  running these tests locally... 17:44  yes, the reason does not seem to be very clear 17:45  Indicates that the target provided to the actions move() method is invalid - outside of the size of the window." 17:45  marius must be doing a move() 17:45  it might be fixed by a newer version of selenium btw 17:45  org.xwiki.test.ui.appwithinminutes.ClassEditorTest.testApplyConfigurationChanges  passes locally if ran individually 17:45  of course one solution is to make sure the element is visible 17:46  same for org.xwiki.test.ui.appwithinminutes.ClassEditorTest.testUpdateSheetAndTemplate  17:46          // This doesn't trigger the :hover CSS pseudo class so we're forced to manually set the display of the tool box. 17:46          new Actions(getDriver().getWrappedDriver()).moveToElement(container).perform(); 17:46  this is the code that fails 17:47  so container must be not visible in the viewport 17:48  would be interesitng to try with http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XCOMMONS-292 17:49  but why does the test pass on my machine? 17:49  because your viewport might be larger maybe 17:49  I guess it depends on the default size of the FF windows 17:49  ok, in any way, do you agree that we can ignore these tests for the M2 release? 17:50  yes 17:50  hmm 17:51  new tetss in error too 17:51  has quit 17:51  jenkins takes long to load pages again 17:52  yes 17:52  the rest tests are failing apparently from the mail I received 17:52  but I can't access ci yet 17:52  what mail? 17:53  jenkins 17:54  brb 17:54  has quit 17:56  has joined #xwiki 18:01  http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-rest/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-rest/1909/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.test.rest/PageResourceTest/testPUTTranslation/ 18:02  I`ve started the test again 18:02  ok, looking at http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-rest/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-rest/ it doesn't look like a flicker 18:02  yes, but it popped out of the blue 18:02  right 18:03  jenkins said it started appearing after my commit 18:03  ... 18:03  "[Misc] Replace right single quotation mark char with left single quotation char" 18:04  that's dubious 18:04  https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/2901bf1258598932863a96ae5a6816315bb92be8 18:04  I know... I`m starting to no longer trust Jenkins on build triggering... 18:04  it's not jenkins 18:05  it's our tests 18:05  they're not deterministic enough most of the time 18:05  this time, but there are a lot of places where you can not determine what triggered that build 18:05  I've never seen a bug there 18:06  why can't you believe this build was triggered by my commit? 18:06  seems correct to me 18:06  not this case. I mean that there are jobs that are triggered but they do not display who was it that triggered them. Which other job or which commit 18:06  :( other failing tests now 18:07  Enygma`: can you give me an example, I've always been able to track it down 18:07  I`ve shown a couple to Marius... will show you one when I see it 18:07  rest test is flickering 18:07  extension tests too apparently 18:07  :( 18:08  http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-extension/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-extension/1203/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui.extension/ExtensionTest/testUpgradeWithMergeConflict/ 18:08  ok, so we are good for release 18:08  that really looks like some async error 18:08  for release yes, but other wise we're not good 18:08  I'd really like that we're back on no flickers 18:09  because it's a pain not to be able to trust the jenkins emails 18:09  I believe this is one of the reason it takes so long to stabilize releases 18:09  we should normally treat each jenkins emai as if the sky was falling 18:10  oh wait 18:10  you aborted the run 18:10  http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/1769/ 18:10  is that normal? 18:11  I needed an agent free for the rest test 18:11  ok 18:11  that's dangerous btw 18:11  (I think) 18:11  what? 18:11  well 18:11  I'm not sure but there's a chance that if we abort a job that it doesn't kill all threads 18:11  so if xe is started 18:12  it's possible it doesn't stop it 18:12  I'm not sure 18:12  but it's something we would need to verify at some point 18:12  that happened locally to me while running the ui tests with maven 18:12  it left a java process hanging with xe on it 18:12  has quit 18:17  guys it seems I get a NPE error when setting the "default value" of a Boolean object 18:18  I'm on a 4.1. Can someone confirm if oyu have a newer version running ? 18:19  sburjan`: Boolean object? 18:19  Enygma`: yes 18:19  what is that? AppWithinMinutes.Boolean? or what? 18:19  attach a Boolean object to a page, and try saving the "Default Value" property. I used "false" 18:19  no, a normal page. nothing to do with AWM 18:20  what is a Boolean object? 18:20  I am talking about the Boolean data type already predefined within XWiki 18:22  when you create a class and you add properties to it. That Boolean I am talking about 18:22  ah, you mean adding a Boolean property to a class and trying to set the default value to that property 18:22  :) 18:22  yes ! :) 18:22  sorry for not explaining myself very clearly 18:23  try using 0 18:23  XWiki boolean properties are stored as 0 and 1 18:24  though I agree that it's a bug to throw such an ugly exception 18:24  you can report it, but it`s a minor issue 18:24  also, sburjan`, I`d like to ask you to please update the release notes for 4.3M2 http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki43M2 18:25  in the testing section 18:25  Enygma`: you're right. It doesn't NPE if I pu 0 or 1 18:25  Enygma`: doing it now.
